Subject: Re: [neat] Re: Intelligently and nonarbitrarily penalising complexity
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=344770077; y=h7bvKRd5zz7f-iQrP4UN6nx6xFIs91DMR90TjIMLUUkO_Lw5PMND
X-Yahoo-Profile: alienseedpod

Hi,

My view on this is that the alternative fitness method I outlined back
in April is the way forward, discussion thread here:

   http://tech.groups.yahoo.com/group/neat/message/5550


In principle this should allow different regions of the search space
to be explored in parallel but also in a more balanced way than the
fitness sharing we currently use, scaling back populations in 'easy'
parts of the search space that might otherwise gain a high population
and consume and unreasonably large proportion of CPU time. I would
suggest that defining CPU resource usage as one of the fitness metrics
in that scheme would be a logical choice for most non-trivial problem
domains to allow some exploration of high CPU usage solutions but with
constraints on how many genomes can explore such strategies.

Colin.
